text: NGC 4313 is an edge-on spiral galaxy located about 50 million light-years away in the constellation Virgo. It was discovered by astronomer William Herschel on March 15, 1784. NGC 4313 is a member of the Virgo Cluster and is classified as LINER and as a Seyfert galaxy. NGC 4313 has undergone ram-pressure stripping in the past. ==Black Hole== NGC 4313 may harbor an intermediate-mass black hole with an estimated mass of 200,000 (2*10^5) solar masses. ==See also== * List of NGC objects (4001–5000) ==References== ==External links== 4313 040105 Category:Virgo (constellation) Category:Astronomical objects discovered in 1784 Category:Spiral galaxies 07445 Category:Virgo Cluster Category:LINER galaxies Category:Seyfert galaxies
title: NGC 4313
